intro: Uragoga gomeziana, commonly known as the Gomeziana uragoga, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
